articles.title: FIFA eyes disciplinary action against Argentina, Brazil
articles.description: Four of Argentina's Premier League players were accused of flouting quarantine requirements in Sao Paulo and of falsifying Brazilian coronavirus declarations.
articles.content:
Follow us on Image Source : GETTY IMAGES FIFA eyes disciplinary action against Argentina, Brazil

articles.title: Mexico's top court decriminalizes abortion in 'watershed moment'
articles.description: The decision in the world's second-biggest Roman Catholic country means that courts can no longer prosecute abortion cases, and follows the historic legalization of the right in Argentina, which took effect earlier this year. Arturo Zaldivar, president of the Mexican Supreme Court, hailed the decision as "a watershed moment" for all women, especially the most vulnerable.
articles.content: Mexico's Supreme Court unanimously ruled on Tuesday that penalizing abortion is unconstitutional, a major victory for advocates of women's health and human rights, just as parts of the United States enact tougher laws against the practice. The decisi... [3224 chars]

articles.title: Fallout continues after Argentina v Brazil World Cup qualifier ends with health officials storming the field
articles.description: Argentina’s match against Brazil was suspended after health officials stormed the pitch – now FIFA is taking action.
articles.content:
Disciplinary proceedings have been opened by FIFA against Argentina and Brazil over the chaos that led to their World Cup qualifier being suspended.
Sunday’s match was halted after seven minutes on Sunday when Brazilian health officials stormed the f... [1763 chars]

articles.title: FIFA considers disciplinary action from suspended Argentina-Brazil match
articles.description: Disciplinary proceedings were opened by FIFA against Argentina and Brazil on Tuesday over the chaos that led to their World Cup qualifier being suspended after Brazilian health officials stormed the field to question the quarantine status of players.

articles.title: Argentina's 2020/21 soybean sales reach 28.9 mln tonnes - ministry
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept 7 (Reuters) - Argentine farmers have sold a total 28.9 million tonnes of soybeans from the 2020/21 crop, after registering sales over a seven-day period of 462,300 tonnes, the Ministry of Agriculture said on Tuesday.The sales volume of one of Argentina's main crops lagged that of the previous season, when by this point some 30.8 million tonnes of the oilseed
articles.content:
BUENOS AIRES, Sept 7 (Reuters) - Argentine farmers have sold a total 28.9 million tonnes of soybeans from the 2020/21 crop, after registering sales over a seven-day period of 462,300 tonnes, the Ministry of Agriculture said on Tuesday.

articles.title: FIFA eyes disciplinary action against Argentina, Brazil
articles.description: FIFA cited ongoing legal procedures as the reason it could not provide specifics on the alleged rule breaches or comment.
articles.content: Disciplinary proceedings were opened by FIFA against Argentina and Brazil on Tuesday over the chaos that led to their World Cup qualifier being suspended after Brazilian health officials stormed the field to question the quarantine status of players.... [4019 chars]

articles.title: Brazil vs Argentina: FIFA opens disciplinary proceedings following suspension of World Cup Qualifier
articles.description: Cristian Romero and Giovani Lo Celso are set to be disciplined and fined by Tottenham for joining up with the Argentina squad over the international break while Aston Villas Emi Buendia and Emi Martinez should escape retrospective action from their club following alleged Covid breaches
articles.content:
FIFA has opened disciplinary proceedings involving both the Brazilian and Argentinian football associations following the suspension of Sunday's World Cup Qualifier at the Neo Quimica Arena in Sao Paulo.
The match was called off amid extraordinary sc... [2714 chars]

articles.title: FIFA Opens Investigation into Abandoned Brazil-Argentina World Cup Qualifier
articles.description: FIFA opened disciplinary proceedings into World Cup qualifier between Brazil and Argentina which was abandoned after five minutes amid farcical scenes.
articles.content:
World football’s governing body FIFA has opened disciplinary proceedings into Sunday’s Brazil v Argentina World Cup qualifier which was abandoned after five minutes amid farcical scenes.
